subject: TestUtil v. 1.1 : Verification Facilitator (VF)
msgSnippet: TestUtil v. 1.1 was released today enabling verifying all accessor method pairs in a complete application with one line of unit test code. A Verification
messageBody:
TestUtil v. 1.1 was released today enabling verifying all accessor
method pairs in a complete application with one line of unit test
code.

A Verification Facilitator (VF) promotes reducing the volume of
custom hand-coding - pattern typed objects are (typically)
reflectively interrogated and verified at runtime. An observed side-
effect of AV testing is pattern defragmentation, component role
clarification and overall design coherence.

TestUtil is a Java open source VF providing a low-effort strategy
for unit testing all matching accessor methods on mutable objects
with a single line of test code. It is compatible with both in-
container and outside-the-container strategies built upon JUnit
style testing. TestUtil resources (including sample outputs) are
available at:

http://gtcgroup.com/util/index.html


As always - feedback is welcome. Particularily on this notion of
runtime verification within a JUnit context.

_Marvin
